comment: I took her online , and Her class is pretty easy. There are about about 15 discussion post for the semester you are required to do 4 by end of the semester. Shes really slow to grade and hard to contact , Ive barely spoken to her the whole semester, but it was definitely an easy A class ,I barely even tried and still passed with a A.

One of the easiest online classes, hands down. Weekly modules but you only have to do 4/15, textbook readings only become important during the three tests throughout the semester. There's a museum report, which is easy, and extra credit through cengage quizzes. She's a bit hard to contact, at least online, but easy A if you need an extra course.

This class was pretty easy. The semester consisted of 3 tests, a museum project, 4 DP, and an introduction assignment. There are 14 DP throughout the semester, but you only have to do 4. Shes an easy grader. Because its online I only spoke to her once or twice and she was very kind. I recommend taking her class if all you need is the credit.

Overall, an easy class you don't have to worry about passing. Really only 4 discussion posts, a couple tests, and a museum report for the whole semester. None of it is too complicated or in-depth for a basic art class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: her class is the best and very easy. I know nothing about art but i still got an A and it was a fun class. she is also very leniant with assignments and gives extra credit. i would definitely take her again
Easy A. Nice, sweet lady who has a passion for art. Four 75-100 word discussion posts and 3 Lockdown Browser tests. Straightforward, simple class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Hightower was the sweetest professor Ive had at KSU so far. She understands that most people are taking her class to fulfill their art credit, but she is so caring for her students and you can tell that she really takes pride in her job. She is so sweet and helpful! There is also minimal work, so you dont ever have to stress about her class.
You only have to answer 4 discussion posts the whole semester and their are only 3 tests that are very straightforward. Easy online choice.

I took Dr. Hightower for ART1107 online. She is chill and you don't really need to read the book. You have to do 4 out of 10 discussion posts throughout the whole semester. Three tests, easy if you study. Highly recommend taking her for an easy A.

Sweet lady and easy professor. Easily accessible outside of class, minimal homework every week, clear instructions, and really cares about students. 3 Lockdown Broswer tests, a couple discussion posts on recently read modules, and weekly Powerpoints. Easy A if you try, would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: art 1107 online with her is an easy A. you only need to 4 discussion posts and 3 exams for the whole semester. she is an easy grader and also offers extra credit 10/10 recommend
Dr. Hightower is one of my top favorite professors I have taken. She was definitely my favorite within the major. Congratulations on retirement you will be missed!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Hightower is very knowledgeable of the fashion world. She takes attendance and after you miss 3 your grade drops a letter. She goes by the textbook and all of her tests are on D2l. Discussion questions are mandatory but you only do 6 out of the 10 she posts. She really wants her students to succeed and gives extra credit. Easy A!

Dr. Hightower is one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw State. She is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about her lectures. Make sure to read and make use of her online posts, and dont skip class! You will walk out of her courses prepared and informed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hightower is very sweet! She does a lot of amazing work outside of teaching. Attendance is mandatory and participation in online discussions matter, but she is not a tough grader. Most material was on d2l in the powerpoints.

you have to know everything in all the book chapters, her pre lecture power points, her class lecture power points and added links she puts on d2l. its a lot. She  calls people unsmart for not speaking in class. The only thing going for her is her tests are online but she gives the least amount of time possible so your rushing through it.

Hightower has good intentions, but her class is very frustrating. The beginning of this class was so slow, boring, and she will push her idea of the project until it's pretty much her design. Class lecture is very redundant, she spends LOTS of time on one simple idea such as not cutting your hand off when using an exacto. Sweet lady, weak teacher.

She has no idea what's going on. Ever. You will never know what your homework is, you'll never finish because there's a ton of it, and you'll never get an A because she is ridiculous and counts off for minuscule details. Trust me, do NOT take this professor.
Terrible. You will get points deducted for guidelines/assignments never mentioned. She will spend all class talking in circles and wasting time. Take her if you have no other choice.
Horrible teacher, never clear and the gyst program is ridiculous. Don't take her if you can!
She is a nice woman, but not good enough to be a teacher, cannot explain the project well, and students always have a hard time to understand her! I will not take her anymore!!!!!
Tiptoe through the guidelines, and you'll do fine.

Most of her lectures come from the book, but she flies through them so fast, and stops on each slide for like 10 seconds. Her tests are poorly worded and don't make sense, but she will drop a question if 50% of the class misses it. She grades on a curve. Attendance is mandatory (she gives daily grades). Lot of work, but easy if you read the book.

She is a great teacher! She's incredibly helpful with projects and really nice. It is a lot of work, but there's a lot to learn. I don't think she's scatter brained, I think she's just passionate about what she teaches. In the end, it all does make sense, and it changed the way I see things. I definitely recommend her!

I had her for Maymester.  Super easy.  Attendance is mandatory since its a Maymester but she's entertaining.  There are 5 quizzes which are very easy and a final which is mostly repeat questions from the quizzes.  I got a 99 in the class.

I LOVED this class. Professor Hightower was a great teacher. She was really supportive and gave great advice. She encourages we work together and support each other. She always tries to find ways to help us save money and just wants us to find our place as artists. I would love to have her for other classes!

Best teacher ever. Our class was like one big family! She does give some ridiculous and seemingly pointless assignments sometimes, but overall, she is great. VERY encouraging which is an extremely good trait to have in a beginning art class! I wish I could take her for every art class. She is awesome.

Art is a lot of money, this is no exception. You will use a lot of your paper and time, unless you dont care. Attendance is important, finals were pretty easy. 2D Design is not my thing and I still made a B. I would take her again. She knows what she is talking about, but MAKE SURE you are clear on your homework/assignments

Dr.Hightower would be someone that I consider a good mentor or friend.She does care about her students a lot.But she is very VERY picky.If you are an inch off on something(since it is art)she WILL realize it. She also posts too many guidelines and keeps pushing you until the project is basically hers. You spend so much money
She is a very nice woman, but not a good teacher. Very interesting too; she always wears half orange and half blue shadow.

Dr. hightower is very helpful and  a genuinely caring professor. She is VERY nit-picky about work and you will do portions of projects over and over again. at times she makes you feel like nothing is good enough, but in a way it helps to strengthen your work. She loves her profession and she cares for your well being. also, she takes role every day

The good: she encourages interaction with your peers and mentors you throughout the projects. The bad: the organization of the class is poor, and the syllabus was completely irreverent. Poor time management - wasted a lot of class time. Materials cost got very high - she gives no thought whatsoever to the shallowness of a student's pocket.

She will spend half your class time explaining things that a 5 y/o could understand. And she will explain those things 5 times but in different ways. Oh, dont let the fact that you payed for this class fool you. This is your job, not a class. And if you dont bring something to class your fired and she will rant about that for half the class too.

She wastes your time. If you want a good grade listen to her ideas of how she wants you to do your projects. Dont be late, even though she is almost always 15 minutes late to class. She doesnt care if you cannot afford the supplies she asks you to get for projects because she will tell you that you shouldnt be an art major.

Fun interesting class. However, she gets caught up on the first 1or2 projects and throws everything at you right at the end. Never complain about material costs--she'll tell you to leave. Never disagree with her suggestions: you'll get great grades if you do what she suggests. Try to get everything done right and on time, or else "you're fired!"

Dr. Hightower makes sure to get everyone in the class involved with everyone else's projects. She takes a lot of time in getting feedback, but will also go off on tangents; stories about her, her family, her son, etc. If you do what she says and talk about compromising your idea and hers, she will be happy. It's more of a class in compromising.

I had Dr. Hightower for 2-D design.  I was really frustrated with the class because she's rather scatterbrained and goes off topic easily.  Beginning is very, very slow, and piles on projects at the end.  Very stressful if you're not an organized person.
Don't be scared off by the fact she is department head, while we moved slower than the other sections of this same class we learned a whole lot. Great Teacher!
